column2: VERMONT DMV TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign means:
column8: Right turn permitted on red light

column2: 2. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column8: blue and white.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 4. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column6: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.

column2: 5. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
column8: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.

column2: 6. This sign warns drivers of:
column6: a low place in the road.
column8: low clearance.

column2: 7. Where are yield signs usually placed?
column4: Where auxiliary roads lead into major roads.
column8: At intersections, if there is no marked stop line.
column10: Where major roads lead into  auxiliary roads.

column2: 8. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
column8: Service signs

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns in both directions of travel.
column6: Sharp left turns ahead, in both directions.
column8: Vehicles may only travel in the center lane.
column10: The center lane in both directions of travel will soon turn left.

column2: 10. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column8: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column10: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 11. These are:
column8: speed limit signs.

column2: 12. This sign indicates:
column6: Do not use your phone while driving
column8: Emergency line available

column2: 13. When approaching a railroad crossing drivers should:
column8: look for a train.

column2: 14. Warning signs are normally:
column8: red.

column2: 15. When you prepare to make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: approach the turn in the left lane or from the left side of a single lane.
column6: approach the turn in the right lane or from the right side of a single lane.
column8: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.

column2: 16. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column6: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 17. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: require more space for turning movements.
column6: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.
column8: are easier for the driver to operate.
column10: take longer than cars to stop.

column2: 18. ABS is the acronym for:
column8: Average-Beam System

column2: 19. When driving in icy or snowy conditions, to avoid crashes drivers should:
column4: add extra weight to the vehicle to improve traction.
column6: reduce speed and increase following distance.
column8: engage 4 wheel drive on the vehicle.
column10: get off the highway as quickly as possible.

column2: 20. What is the only effective method to reduce your BAC?
column4: Eating before or while you drink.
column8: Drinking coffee.
column10: Not drinking over a period of time.
